body:
We found a Contributor License Agreement for you (the sender of this pull request), but were unable to find agreements for the commit author(s).  If you authored these, maybe you used a different email address in the git commits than was used to sign the CLA ([login here](https://cla.developers.google.com/) to double check)?  If these were authored by someone else, then they will need to sign a CLA as well, and confirm that they're okay with these being contributed to Google.

<!-- need_author_cla -->
I'll merge master again to solve the conflicts.
The InteropTest failure is due to Python failing to download and install some package, I suppose due to a connection problem; so I'll rerun it.
Ping. Release merges have a high tendency to develop merge conflicts as master keeps advancing :) Plus it's GA blocking for us.

Should we wait for 0.15 to be merged, as now I'm getting errors using this new merge when I compile my client - I can help investigate what the core cause is:

``` Bash
$ googleapis/test-compile.sh

```

Thanks,
~p

Hi Paul, that looks like a version mismatch between BoringSSL/OpenSSL and what the C++ library expects. I'm surprised this PR would affect any of those things (the BoringSSL used by Cocoapods comes from a different place than that used by the C++ library). Can you open an issue for it, to help us tracking, and also confirm that the problem disappears in the commit prior to this merge?

Hi Jorge,

You got me thinking...  If I specify the boringssl library during my build I get that a symbol is hidden (i.e. can't referenced from another shared library).  The code for the client I use is located at  https://github.com/grpc/grpc/issues/7131#issuecomment-230182747, for which I followed the steps I posted under issue #7131.

The way I compiled above code was as follows, which used to compile without specifying `-lboringssl`:

```
export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=$LD_LIBRARY_PATH:../libs/opt:../libs/opt/protobuf:/home/pgrosu/apps/protobuf/lib
export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=$LD_LIBRARY_PATH:/home/pgrosu/apps/protobuf/lib
export GRPC_DEFAULT_SSL_ROOTS_FILE_PATH=/home/pgrosu/apps/grpc/etc/roots.pem
export GOOGLE_APPLICATION_CREDENTIALS=ya...[my access token]...

g++ -std=c++11 -L/usr/lib -L../libs/opt -L/home/pgrosu/apps/protobuf/lib -I./gens -I/home/pgrosu/apps/protobuf/include -I../include -lgrpc++ -lprotobuf  client.cc gens/*.o -o client ; ./client
```

I didn't need to specify the boringssl library before, but if I specify it then the hidden symbol issue comes up:

```
$ g++ -std=c++11 -L/usr/lib -L../libs/opt -L/home/pgrosu/apps/protobuf/lib -I./gens -I/home/pgrosu/apps/protobuf/include -I../include -lgrpc++ -lprotobuf -lboringssl client.cc gens/*.o -o client
/usr/bin/ld: skipping incompatible /usr/lib/libm.so when searching for -lm
/usr/bin/ld: skipping incompatible /usr/lib/libc.so when searching for -lc
/usr/bin/ld: client: hidden symbol `SSL_CTX_free' in ../libs/opt/libboringssl.a(ssl_lib.o) is referenced by DSO
/usr/bin/ld: final link failed: Nonrepresentable section on output
collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
$
```

I can create an issue, but I'll continue to dig for a possible solution.

Thanks,
Paul
Please, definitely open an issue, because someone from the C++ side will be much more helpful than I can be here.

Hi Jorge,

Ok, I found a fix via the following and will submit an issue:

```
$ cp Makefile Makefile-orig
$ sed s/-fvisibility=hidden//g Makefile > Makefile-not-hidden
$ cp Makefile-not-hidden Makefile
```

Thank you for getting us help with @yang-g on https://github.com/grpc/grpc/issues/7131.

Hope you have a great weekend!
Paul
@jcanizales The undefined reference error is not caused by this PR. Hopefully #7292 could fix it.

Hi Jorge and Yuchen,

I submitted issue #7298 with all the steps I performed, including the above fix.  The undefined reference was initially partially fixed by referencing the BoringSSL library during the compilation of the client via `-lboringssl`.  What fixed it was to remove the hidden visibility of the symbols from the [grpc Makefile](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/master/Makefile) through the above [Makefile fix](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/pull/7219#issuecomment-231481517).  Let's test it again after #7292 is merged, but the system that I mostly use is Linux, which could behave differently than a Mac.

I'm sure we will get to a solution that is best for all the users.

Cheers,
Paul
